page.title: 09A FARM VISIT IN SUMMER
page.content: Last week we went to Tan Llan to watch the sheep being sheared with an electric machine.The fleece was folded up and put in a large sack.Then we saw the corn growing in the field. Today we visited the farm to see Mr Jones put the big bales of silage in the huge sacks which cost Â£1.25.The spike on the tractor picked up the big bales and held it up while Eirian and Mr. Jones put the bag around the bale and fastened it.{( Richard Sharp aged 6.) Fe fuon ni yn Tan Llan yn gweld nhw'n cneifio.Ar ol lapio'r cnu roedden nhw yn ei roi mewn sach fawr ac wedyn roedden nhw'n rhoi nod ar y ddafad.Fe fuon ni hefyd yn gweld nhw'n lapio'r byrnau silwair mawr. Roedd bachyn ar flaen y tractor yn dal y silwair i fyny a dyma Mr. Jones ac Eirian yn rhoi'r bag amdano. Mae'r bagiau yn Â£1.25 yr un.{( Elen Roberts 6 oed.)
